hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Fire Violations Shut Factory

body.head.byline: By EMILY VASQUEZ; Compiled by John Sullivan

block.p: Fire officials shut down a garment factory on 60th Street near 12th Avenue in Borough Park yesterday, ordering about 15 workers to leave because of safety hazards posed by piles of cloth and other materials in the basement and insufficient access to the exits. A Buildings Department official said citations were issued to the factory owners for blocked exits, prior construction on the premises without a permit and illegal occupancy.
